labels.label:
0. Hive - table used for results: crypto_rates_2 which is saved in parameter: master_dataset_path
1. HDFS - Master dataset is located at: /user/vagrant/projekt/masterdataset/crypto_rates which is saved in parameter: master_dataset_path
3. HDFS - temporary files are stored in directory: /user/vagrant/projekt/hive/temp which is saved in parameter: hdfs_temp_folder
4. Hive - table used for temporary results (if exists - will be deleted): temp_table_crypto_rates_2 which is saved in parameter: hive_temp_table_name
2. Transform AVRO to JSON, filter columns, change names
0. Create hive table for crypto rates (unnecessary, for testing)
3. Convert JSON to AVRO to ORC, rename and save to a temporary location in HDFS
4. Create Hive Query Language script to insert the newly saved ORC into a temp table (deletes it from HDFS) then insert it's contents into a partitioned and clustered Hive table

Reads new AVRO files about rates of cryptocurrencies, cleans and extracts data and puts to Hive table. Details: 1. Find new files in the master dataset - every 5 minutes. 2. Convert AVRO to JSON. 3. Rename timestamp, filter columns (leave: name, rate, timestamp). 4. Add year, month, day to the JSON keys. 5. Merge prepared JSONs to create a bigger file. 6. Save JSON as ORC in HDFS in a temporary location. (converts JSON to AVRO and then to ORC) 7. Fills in the Hive QL script with the path and filename of the new file and executes it. 8. New rows are inserted in crypto_rates_2, which is clustered by currency name and partitioned by date. Note: HQL script creates the output table if it does not exist.
1. Loading new AVRO files from master dataset from HDFS

entry.value: select id as cryptocurrency_name, rateUSD as rate_in_usd, timestamp_date from flowfile

Create table if not exists ${hive_output_rates} ( cryptocurrency_name STRING, rate_in_usd DOUBLE, timestamp_date TIMESTAMP ) PARTITIONED BY (year INT, month INT, day INT) clustered by (cryptocurrency_name) into 15 buckets ROW FORMAT DELIMITED FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' LINES TERMINATED BY '\n' stored as orc;
